body.p: When I wander my way into undergraduate classrooms to talk about technical writing, I ask students "What makes a technical writer a professional technical writer?" Eager to impress, typically they respond:

li.p: Professional writers have internalized the craft
Professional writers are members of a group that produces successful doc
Professional writers develop content that reflects the best practices of an industry
Professional writers have appropriate degrees from institutions of higher learning.

body.p: The punchline back to the students is prosaic, but simple. Professional technical writers are paid by one or more employers to add value to some product or service. The good news is that DITA can be a strong performer in the area of adding value. More than other authoring frameworks I have used, you can quickly identify and deploy those features and capabilities in DITA that enhance business value. The challenge is differentiating the ones which almost always add value from the ones which are esoteric, useless, or boutiquey.
"No man but a blockhead ever wrote, except for money."Boswell: Life
